questions.question: When did Adolf Hitler come to power in Germany?
questions.explanation: Adolf Hitler became the leader of Germany in 1933.

questions.question: Which country did Germany invade in 1939, leading to Britain declaring war?
questions.explanation: Hitler’s invasion of Poland in 1939 caused Britain and France to declare war.

questions.question: Which countries made up the Axis powers?
questions.explanation: The Axis powers were Germany, Italy, and Japan.

questions.question: Who became British Prime Minister in 1940?
questions.explanation: Winston Churchill became Prime Minister in May 1940.

questions.question: What was the Dunkirk evacuation known for?
questions.explanation: The Dunkirk evacuation saved over 300,000 Allied soldiers.

questions.question: What phrase came from the Dunkirk evacuation?
questions.explanation: ‘The Dunkirk spirit’ refers to British bravery and teamwork during the evacuation.

questions.question: What was the Battle of Britain?
choices: A battle for air control over Britain
questions.explanation: The Battle of Britain was an air battle fought in 1940 between the RAF and the German air force.

questions.question: Which planes were key in the Battle of Britain?
questions.explanation: The RAF used the Spitfire and the Hurricane, both made in Britain.

questions.question: What was the German bombing campaign on British cities called?
questions.explanation: The Blitz was the German bombing campaign against British cities.

questions.question: Which city was almost destroyed during the Blitz?
questions.explanation: Coventry was almost totally destroyed during the Blitz.

questions.question: When did Japan attack Pearl Harbor?
questions.explanation: Japan attacked Pearl Harbor in December 1941, bringing the US into the war.

questions.question: Which country did Germany invade in 1941 in the largest invasion in history?
questions.explanation: Germany invaded the Soviet Union in 1941.

questions.question: What was D-Day?
questions.explanation: D-Day was the Allied invasion of Normandy on 6 June 1944.

questions.question: When did Germany surrender?
questions.explanation: Germany surrendered in May 1945.

questions.question: How did the war with Japan end?
choices: After the US dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki
questions.explanation: The war ended after the US dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in August 1945.

questions.question: Who first split the atom?
questions.explanation: New Zealand-born Ernest Rutherford, working in the UK, first split the atom.

questions.question: In which of these British scientists helped develop the atomic bomb?
questions.explanation: British scientists took part in the Manhattan Project in the US.

questions.question: Who discovered penicillin?
questions.explanation: Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin in 1928.

questions.question: Who developed penicillin into a usable drug?
questions.explanation: Howard Florey and Ernst Chain developed penicillin for medical use.

questions.question: When did Alexander Fleming win the Nobel Prize in Medicine?
questions.explanation: Fleming won the Nobel Prize in Medicine in 1945.

questions.question: When did Winston Churchill return as Prime Minister after losing in 1945?
questions.explanation: Churchill returned as Prime Minister in 1951.

questions.question: When did Winston Churchill die?
questions.explanation: Churchill died in 1965 and was given a state funeral.

questions.question: When was Winston Churchill voted the greatest Briton of all time?
questions.explanation: Churchill was voted the greatest Briton in a 2002 public poll.
